name: Dips - Bar Tricep
description: A bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the triceps, along with the chest and shoulders.
howTo: Grip parallel bars and lift yourself up so your arms are straight. Lean slightly forward and lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor. Push yourself back up to the starting position.

name: Barbell Curls
description: A fundamental exercise for building the biceps, involving lifting a barbell in a curling motion to isolate the arm muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip at shoulder-width. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up towards your chest, then lower it back down slowly.

name: Barbell French Press
description: A triceps exercise that involves lifting a barbell in a lying position to target the triceps muscles.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench holding a barbell with an overhand grip. Extend your arms straight up, then slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows. Extend your arms back to the starting position.

name: Barbell Spider Curl - Incline
description: An isolation exercise that targets the biceps, performed on an incline bench to enhance the peak contraction of the biceps.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench with a barbell in your hands, arms hanging down. Curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps at the top, then slowly lower it back down.

name: Bench Press - Close Grip
description: A compound exercise that targets the triceps and chest by using a closer grip on the barbell during the bench press.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart or closer. Lower the bar to your mid-chest, then press it back up to full extension.

name: Bench Press - Reverse Grip
description: A variation of the bench press that emphasizes the upper chest and triceps by using an underhand grip on the barbell.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing towards you) about shoulder-width apart. Lower the bar to your lower chest, then press it back up to full extension.

name: Bodyweight Curls
description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the biceps by using your own body weight for resistance.
howTo: Find a sturdy horizontal bar at waist height. Grip the bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart. Lean back with your feet extended in front of you, keeping your body straight. Pull your chest towards the bar by bending your elbows, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight French Press
description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the triceps by using your own body weight for resistance.
howTo: Position yourself under a sturdy bar at waist height with your body at an angle. Grip the bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart. Keeping your body straight, bend your elbows to lower your head under the bar, then extend your arms to return to the starting position.

name: Dead Skulls
description: A variation of the skull crusher exercise that targets the triceps, performed from a dead stop to increase intensity and focus on the triceps.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench holding an EZ bar or barbell with an overhand grip. Lower the bar to the bench behind your head, touching the bench gently to come to a dead stop. From the dead stop position, press the bar back up to full extension, focusing on your triceps.

name: Dips - Bench
description: A bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the triceps, along with the chest and shoulders, using a bench for support.
howTo: Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands gripping the edge beside your hips. Walk your feet forward and slide your hips off the bench. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor, then press back up to the starting position.

name: Dips - Triceps
description: A bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the triceps, along with the chest and shoulders, using parallel bars for support.
howTo: Grip parallel bars and lift yourself up so your arms are straight. Keep your body upright and lower yourself by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor. Push yourself back up to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Curls
description: A fundamental exercise for building the biceps, involving lifting dumbbells in a curling motion to isolate the arm muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down slowly.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Alternating
description: A fundamental exercise for building the biceps, performed by alternately curling each dumbbell to isolate and target the arm muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your torso and alternately curl each dumbbell up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down slowly.

name: Dumbbell Curls - External Rotation
description: A variation of dumbbell curls that incorporates an external rotation to target the biceps and forearms more effectively.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while simultaneously rotating your wrists outward. At the top of the movement, your palms should be facing forward. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, rotating your wrists back inward.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Incline
description: A variation of the dumbbell curl performed on an incline bench, targeting the biceps with an increased range of motion.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees. Sit back on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your torso. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Internal Rotation
description: A variation of dumbbell curls that incorporates an internal rotation to target the biceps and forearms, enhancing the development of the inner biceps.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while simultaneously rotating your wrists inward. At the top of the movement, your palms should be facing your shoulders. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, rotating your wrists back outward.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Rocking
description: A variation of dumbbell curls that incorporates a rocking motion to add momentum, allowing for the use of heavier weights and targeting the biceps with dynamic movement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while slightly rocking your body back and forth to generate momentum. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, controlling the movement.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Seated Supinated
description: A variation of dumbbell curls performed in a seated position, focusing on supinating the wrists to target the biceps more effectively.
howTo: Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while supinating your wrists so that your palms face upwards at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the exercise.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Supinated
description: A fundamental exercise for building the biceps, performed by curling dumbbells with a supinated (palms up) grip to fully engage the biceps.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders while keeping your palms facing upwards throughout the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Curls - Wall
description: A variation of dumbbell curls performed against a wall to minimize cheating and isolate the biceps more effectively.
howTo: Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your torso and your back flat against the wall. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then slowly lower them back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Drag Curls
description: A bicep curl variation that focuses on the long head of the biceps by dragging the dumbbells up the body.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Instead of curling the dumbbells directly up, drag them along your body towards your shoulders by pulling your elbows back. The dumbbells should stay in contact with your torso throughout the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Drags - Angled
description: A variation of the drag curl that emphasizes the upper biceps and forearms by performing the movement at an angle.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with an underhand grip. As you curl the dumbbells, angle your arms back slightly, dragging the dumbbells along your body and keeping them close to your torso. Focus on pulling your elbows back as you lift. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining the angle throughout the descent.

name: Dumbbell French Press
description: A triceps isolation exercise that involves extending the arms overhead with dumbbells to target the triceps muscles effectively.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms straight above your chest with the dumbbells touching each other. Slowly bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards the bench just above your head. Extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on using your triceps to move the weight.

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curls
description: A variation of the traditional curl that targets the brachialis and brachioradialis muscles, using a neutral grip to mimic the motion of swinging a hammer.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing your torso (neutral grip). Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders without rotating your forearms. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Kickbacks - Slight Incline
description: A triceps exercise performed on a slightly inclined bench to enhance the engagement of the triceps through an increased range of motion.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a slight angle. Lean forward to lie your chest against the bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Keep your elbows tucked close to your body and bent at a 90-degree angle. Extend your arms back, fully straightening them to lift the dumbbells in a smooth arc, then slowly return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Partial Curls
description: A bicep curl variation that focuses on the lower range of the curl to increase tension and strengthen the biceps.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Start with your arms fully extended, curl the dumbbells up halfway so that your forearms are parallel to the floor, then lower them back to the starting position. Focus on maintaining tension in the biceps throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Push-ups - Decline
description: A variation of the traditional push-up that uses dumbbells and an elevated surface for the feet to increase the intensity and target the upper chest and shoulders more effectively.
howTo: Place your feet on an elevated surface such as a bench and hold a pair of dumbbells positioned on the floor in a grip that allows your hands to be stable. Perform a push-up by lowering your chest to the dumbbells while maintaining a straight body line, then press up to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Push-ups - Flat
description: A push-up variation using dumbbells to enhance wrist positioning and increase the range of motion, targeting the chest, triceps, and core muscles.
howTo: Place two dumbbells on the floor at shoulder-width apart. Grip the handles of the dumbbells with each hand and set yourself in a plank position. Keep your body straight and lower yourself down until your chest is just above the dumbbells. Press back up to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Push-ups - Incline
description: A push-up variation using dumbbells on an inclined surface to decrease the intensity compared to flat push-ups, making it easier on the upper body while still targeting the chest, triceps, and shoulders.
howTo: Place two dumbbells on an inclined surface such as a bench. Grip the handles with each hand and set yourself in a plank position with your feet on the ground and hands elevated. Keep your body straight and lower yourself down until your chest nearly touches the bench. Press back up to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Skull Crushers
description: A triceps isolation exercise that involves lying on a bench and extending dumbbells from near the forehead to above the chest, effectively targeting the triceps muscles.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms straight above your chest, palms facing each other. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards your forehead or just beside your head. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms. Extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting your triceps.

name: Dumbbell Skull Crushers - Incline
description: An incline variation of the traditional skull crusher, targeting the triceps with a focus on the long head, providing a different angle to enhance muscle activation.
howTo: Lie on an incline bench set at a 30-45 degree angle with a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms above your chest with your palms facing each other. Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards your forehead or just beside your head. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms. Extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting your triceps.

name: Dumbbell Spider Curls
description: An isolation bicep curl performed on an incline bench, facing down, to prevent momentum and increase bicep activation by eliminating body sway.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench with your chest at the top of the bench. Let your arms hang straight down, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps at the top, then slowly lower them back down to full arm extension.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Push-ups - Neutral
description: A variation of push-ups performed with dumbbells to maintain a neutral grip, targeting the triceps more intensively by keeping the arms close to the body.
howTo: Place two dumbbells on the floor at shoulder-width apart. Grip the handles of the dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and position yourself in a high plank position. Keep your elbows close to your body as you lower yourself down until your chest is just above the dumbbells. Press back up to the starting position, focusing on using your triceps.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Push-ups - Slightly Pronated
description: A tricep-focused push-up variation using dumbbells with a slightly pronated grip to increase the activation of the tricep muscles and provide wrist comfort.
howTo: Position two dumbbells on the floor, slightly turned inwards for a pronated grip. Grip the dumbbells, set yourself in a plank position with your hands slightly narrower than shoulder width. Keep your elbows close to your sides as you lower your body, ensuring your forearms remain perpendicular to the floor. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on extending through the triceps.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Push-ups - Slightly Supinated
description: A challenging variation of tricep push-ups performed with dumbbells, where the wrists are slightly supinated to increase engagement of the tricep muscles and improve wrist ergonomics.
howTo: Place two dumbbells on the floor and grip them with a slightly outward (supinated) angle. Set up in a plank position with your hands holding the dumbbells directly under your shoulders. Keep your body straight and elbows close to your body as you lower yourself down, ensuring your elbows do not flare out. Press up through the triceps to return to the starting position.

name: EZ Bar Curls
description: A popular bicep curl variation using an EZ curl bar, which reduces wrist strain and allows for a more comfortable grip, targeting the biceps effectively.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ curl bar with an underhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the bar up towards your shoulders. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, keeping the movement controlled.

name: EZ Bar Drag Curls
description: A bicep curl variation using an EZ curl bar that involves dragging the bar up the torso to shift the focus towards the upper part of the biceps.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ curl bar with an underhand grip. As you curl the bar, simultaneously lean back slightly and drag the bar along your body as close as possible. The elbows should move back slightly as you lift. At the top of the curl, the bar should be close to your upper abdomen or lower chest. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.

name: French Press
description: A triceps isolation exercise performed either seated or lying, using a barbell or dumbbell to extend the arms overhead, effectively targeting the triceps muscles.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench or sit on a bench with back support. Hold a barbell or EZ bar with an overhand grip. Extend your arms directly above your chest. Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly bend your elbows to lower the weight behind your head. Extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting your triceps.

name: Push-ups - Reverse Grip
description: A variation of the standard push-up performed with a reverse grip to enhance upper chest and triceps engagement. This exercise requires bars or handles that allow for a reverse grip.
howTo: Place bars or handles on the ground that allow for a reverse grip. Grip the bars with your palms facing towards you, set yourself up in a standard push-up position. Lower your body to the floor by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position, focusing on contracting the chest and triceps.

name: Skull Crushers - Reverse Grip
description: A variation of the traditional skull crusher exercise using an overhand (reverse) grip to target different parts of the triceps muscles, especially emphasizing the lateral and medial heads.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with a barbell or EZ bar held with an overhand grip. Extend your arms above your chest. Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar towards your forehead. Carefully reverse the motion to extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting the triceps.

name: Single Arm Long Head Incline Curls
description: A bicep curl variation performed on an incline bench, focusing on isolating the long head of the biceps by extending the arm behind the body.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 45-60 degrees. Lie back with one dumbbell in your right hand, arm hanging straight down. Curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow back and fixed. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the left arm.

name: Skull Crushers
description: A triceps isolation exercise also known as a lying triceps extension. It involves extending weights over the head to target the triceps muscle effectively.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with a barbell or EZ bar. Hold the weight with an overhand grip and extend your arms above your chest. Keeping your elbows stationary and upper arms perpendicular to the floor, slowly bend your elbows to lower the weight towards your forehead. Carefully extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting the triceps.

name: Skull Crushers - 45 Degree
description: A variation of the traditional skull crushers performed on a 45-degree incline bench to target the triceps with a different angle, enhancing the stretch and contraction.
howTo: Set an incline bench to 45 degrees. Lie back with a barbell or EZ bar held with an overhand grip. Extend your arms above your chest. Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows to slowly lower the bar towards your forehead. Carefully reverse the motion to extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting the triceps.

name: Skull Crushers - Neutral Grip
description: A triceps isolation exercise performed with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) using dumbbells to target the triceps more effectively and reduce strain on the wrists.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench holding two dumbbells directly above your chest with your palms facing each other. Keep your upper arms stationary and elbows tight. Slowly lower the dumbbells towards the sides of your forehead by bending at the elbows. Pause, then extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting the triceps.

name: Skull Crushers - Rotating Grip
description: A variation of the traditional skull crushers that incorporates a dynamic grip change from pronated to neutral during the movement to engage different aspects of the triceps muscles and increase the exercise complexity.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with an EZ bar or dumbbells. Start with a pronated grip (palms facing away). As you lower the weight towards your forehead, rotate your grip to a neutral position (palms facing each other). When you press the weight back up, rotate your hands back to the pronated position. This rotation should be smooth and synchronized with the movement.

name: Straight Bar Curls
description: A classic exercise for building the biceps, involving lifting a straight barbell in a curling motion to isolate the arm muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a straight barbell with an underhand grip at shoulder-width. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, then lower it back down slowly.

name: Straight Bar Curls - Reverse Grip
description: A variation of the standard barbell curl performed with an overhand (pronated) grip to target the brachioradialis and forearms along with the biceps.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a straight barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down) at shoulder-width. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders, then lower it back down slowly.

name: Straight Bar Drag Curls
description: A bicep curl variation that emphasizes the long head of the biceps by dragging the bar up the torso, shifting the focus to the upper part of the biceps.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a straight barbell with an underhand grip at shoulder-width. As you curl the barbell, drag it up your torso by pulling your elbows back, keeping the bar close to your body. At the top of the movement, the bar should be close to your upper abdomen or lower chest. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.

name: Tricep Press - Close Grip
description: A compound exercise that targets the triceps and chest by using a closer grip on the barbell during the press.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart or closer. Lower the bar to your mid-chest, then press it back up to full extension, focusing on using your triceps to push the weight.

name: Tricep Push-Ups
description: A bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the triceps, along with the chest and shoulders, by keeping the elbows close to the body during the push-up.
howTo: Get into a standard push-up position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders and your elbows tucked close to your body. Lower your body to the ground while keeping your elbows tight against your sides. Push back up to the starting position, focusing on using your triceps to extend your arms.

name: Arnold Press - Modified
description: A variation of the traditional Arnold Press that targets the shoulders, incorporating a modified movement to enhance muscle engagement.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing you. Begin the movement by pressing the dumbbells overhead while simultaneously rotating your wrists so that your palms face forward at the top of the movement. Lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height while rotating your wrists back to the starting position.

name: Arnold Rotations
description: A shoulder exercise that involves rotating the dumbbells during the movement to engage the deltoid muscles comprehensively.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing you. Rotate your wrists to bring your palms forward as you press the dumbbells overhead. Rotate your wrists back to the starting position as you lower the dumbbells to shoulder height, ensuring continuous control and engagement of the deltoid muscles.

name: Arnold Rotations - Lying
description: A variation of the Arnold Press performed in a lying position to target the shoulders with an emphasis on rotational movement for enhanced muscle engagement.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing you. Rotate your wrists to bring your palms forward as you press the dumbbells overhead. Rotate your wrists back to the starting position as you lower the dumbbells to shoulder height, ensuring continuous control and engagement of the deltoid muscles.

name: Arnold Rotations - Slight Incline
description: A variation of the Arnold Press performed on a slight incline to target the shoulders with an emphasis on rotational movement for enhanced muscle engagement.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a slight angle (about 30 degrees). Sit on the bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing you. Rotate your wrists to bring your palms forward as you press the dumbbells overhead. Rotate your wrists back to the starting position as you lower the dumbbells to shoulder height, ensuring continuous control and engagement of the deltoid muscles.

name: Barbell Rear Delt Raise
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids and upper back muscles, performed by lifting a barbell while bent over to emphasize the posterior shoulder muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. With your arms hanging straight down, lift the barbell out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids and upper back muscles, performed by lifting dumbbells while bent over to emphasize the posterior shoulder muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. With your arms hanging straight down, lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise - Partials & Full ROM
description: An advanced variation targeting the rear deltoids, combining partial and full range of motion (ROM) repetitions to maximize muscle engagement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. With your arms hanging straight down, lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are halfway up (partials), then lower them back down. Next, perform a full ROM rep by lifting the dumbbells until your arms are parallel to the floor. Repeat the sequence.

name: Bus Drivers
description: An isolation exercise targeting the shoulders, particularly the front deltoids, by holding and rotating a weight plate in front of the body.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate with both hands at the 9 o'clock and 3 o'clock positions. Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height. Rotate the weight plate like turning a steering wheel, moving your hands up and down alternately. Keep your core engaged and arms extended throughout the movement.

name: Bus Drivers - Incline
description: An isolation exercise targeting the shoulders, particularly the front deltoids, performed on an incline bench to enhance the engagement of the shoulder muscles.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 30-45 degrees. Sit back on the bench holding a weight plate with both hands at the 9 o'clock and 3 o'clock positions. Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height. Rotate the weight plate like turning a steering wheel, moving your hands up and down alternately. Keep your core engaged and arms extended throughout the movement.

name: Bus Drivers - Lying Incline
description: An isolation exercise targeting the shoulders, particularly the front deltoids, performed on an incline bench in a lying position to enhance the engagement of the shoulder muscles.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 30-45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench holding a weight plate with both hands at the 9 o'clock and 3 o'clock positions. Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height. Rotate the weight plate like turning a steering wheel, moving your hands up and down alternately. Keep your core engaged and arms extended throughout the movement.

name: Bus Drivers - Seated
description: An isolation exercise targeting the shoulders, particularly the front deltoids, performed in a seated position to enhance shoulder muscle engagement.
howTo: Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight plate with both hands at the 9 o'clock and 3 o'clock positions. Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height. Rotate the weight plate like turning a steering wheel, moving your hands up and down alternately. Keep your core engaged and arms extended throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise - Pressed Together
description: A shoulder exercise targeting the front deltoids, performed by pressing dumbbells together while raising them in front of the body.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells together, keeping them in contact throughout the movement. Raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, keeping your arms straight. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining the press.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise - Supinated
description: A shoulder exercise targeting the front deltoids, performed by raising dumbbells in front of the body with a supinated (palms up) grip.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing upwards (supinated grip). Keep your arms straight and raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell High Row - Incline
description: An upper back exercise targeting the rear deltoids, traps, and rhomboids, performed on an incline bench to enhance muscle activation.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 30-45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench holding a dumbbell in each hand. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Pull the dumbbells up towards your chest, flaring your elbows out to the sides. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly - Bottom
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids, performed by lifting dumbbells from a bent-over position to emphasize the lower part of the movement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are about halfway up, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly - Full ROM
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids, performed by lifting dumbbells from a bent-over position to achieve a full range of motion, enhancing muscle activation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly - Lying Pronated
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids, performed lying face down on a bench with pronated (palms facing down) grip to enhance rear delt activation.
howTo: Lie face down on a flat or incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing down (pronated grip). Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly - Top
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids, performed by lifting dumbbells from a bent-over position and focusing on the top part of the movement to enhance muscle activation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower the dumbbells halfway down, then lift them back to the top position. Repeat this partial range of motion at the top.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise - Around The Worlds
description: An advanced variation of the rear delt raise that involves a circular motion to target the rear deltoids and upper back muscles.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your knees. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides in a circular motion, bringing them up and around until your arms are parallel to the floor. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner, maintaining the circular motion throughout the exercise.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise - Incline
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids, performed on an incline bench to enhance the engagement of the rear shoulder muscles.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 30-45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the exercise.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise - Incline Around The Worlds
description: An advanced variation of the rear delt raise performed on an incline bench, involving a circular motion to target the rear deltoids and upper back muscles.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 30-45 degrees. Lie face down on the bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides in a circular motion, bringing them up and around until your arms are parallel to the floor. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner, maintaining the circular motion throughout the exercise.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Bottom
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed from a bottom position to emphasize muscle engagement at the start of the movement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Fixed Elbow
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed with fixed elbow position to emphasize shoulder abduction and muscle isolation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Full ROM
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed with a full range of motion to enhance shoulder abduction and muscle activation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner, ensuring a full range of motion throughout the exercise.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Holds
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, emphasizing static holds at the top of the movement to increase time under tension and muscle endurance.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor. Hold this position, keeping tension in the lateral deltoids and shoulder muscles for a specific duration. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Incline
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed on an incline bench to enhance muscle engagement and range of motion.
howTo: Set an incline bench to about 30-45 degrees. Sit or lie sideways on the bench, holding a dumbbell in your top hand with your arm hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbell out to the side until your arm is parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoid to raise the weight. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Partials
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed with partial range of motion to focus on specific portions of the movement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are at a 90-degree angle (parallel to the floor), focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position halfway down, then lift them back to the 90-degree position. Repeat this partial range of motion throughout the exercise.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Scapular Plane
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed in the scapular plane to optimize shoulder mechanics and muscle engagement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down and elbows slightly bent. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides in a slightly forward angle, following the natural plane of the shoulder blades (scapular plane), until your arms are parallel to the floor. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Seated
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed while seated to stabilize the body and focus on shoulder abduction.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Straight Arm
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed with arms straight throughout the movement to emphasize shoulder abduction and muscle isolation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms straight down by your sides. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Maintain straight arms throughout the exercise to isolate the deltoids. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Thumbs Up Slow Motion
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed with thumbs-up grip and slow, controlled movement to maximize muscle engagement and focus on shoulder abduction.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward and thumbs pointing up. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, maintaining the thumbs-up grip throughout. Focus on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights and perform the movement in a slow, controlled manner. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with the same controlled motion.

name: Dumbbell Side Lateral - Top
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed with emphasis on the top portion of the movement to maximize deltoid activation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are slightly above parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Side Laterals - Seated High Incline
description: An isolation exercise targeting the lateral deltoids, performed seated on a high incline bench to emphasize shoulder abduction and muscle activation.
howTo: Set a bench to a high incline (around 60-70 degrees). Sit on the bench with your back supported and feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing inward. Start with your arms hanging straight down. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the lateral deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Plate Front Raise
description: An isolation exercise targeting the anterior deltoids, using a weight plate to enhance shoulder abduction and muscle activation.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate with both hands in front of your thighs, palms facing inward. Keep your arms straight or slightly bent. Lift the weight plate straight up in front of you until your arms are parallel to the floor. Lower the weight plate back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Plate Press - Seated
description: An exercise targeting the shoulders, performed seated using a weight plate to engage the deltoid muscles.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a weight plate with both hands at chest level. Press the weight plate straight overhead until your arms are fully extended. Lower the weight plate back down to chest level in a controlled manner. Maintain a stable seated position throughout the exercise.

name: Plate Raise - Lying Incline
description: An exercise targeting the shoulders, performed lying on an incline bench using a weight plate to enhance deltoid engagement.
howTo: Lie face-up on an incline bench, holding a weight plate with both hands at chest level. Keep your arms straight or slightly bent. Lift the weight plate straight up over your chest until your arms are perpendicular to the bench. Lower the weight plate back down to chest level in a controlled manner.

name: Plate Raise - Seated Supinated
description: An exercise targeting the shoulders, performed seated with a supinated grip using a weight plate to enhance deltoid engagement.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a weight plate with both hands in a supinated (palms facing upward) grip at thigh level. Keep your arms straight or slightly bent. Lift the weight plate straight up in front of you until your arms are parallel to the floor. Lower the weight plate back down to thigh level in a controlled manner.

name: Rear Dumbbell Delt Raises - Incline Partial
description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids, performed on an incline bench to emphasize partial range of motion.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a comfortable angle (around 45 degrees). Lie face down on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Allow your arms to hang straight down towards the floor. Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, focusing on using the rear deltoids to raise the weights. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner, maintaining tension on the rear deltoids throughout.

name: Seated Dumbbell Press - Slightly Supinated
description: An effective shoulder exercise performed seated with dumbbells, emphasizing a slightly supinated grip.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a slightly supinated grip (palms facing inward at a slight angle). Start with the dumbbells at shoulder height, elbows bent. Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height in a controlled manner.

name: Shoulder Press - Incline Barbell
description: A compound exercise targeting the shoulders, performed on an incline bench using a barbell.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a comfortable angle (around 45 degrees). Sit on the bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, and hold a barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lift the barbell over your head until your arms are fully extended. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner, keeping elbows slightly bent at the bottom position to maintain tension on the shoulders.

name: Shoulder Press - Incline Dumbbell Hammer
description: An exercise targeting the shoulders, performed on an incline bench using dumbbells with a neutral grip.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a comfortable angle (around 45 degrees). Sit on the bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Lift the dumbbells over your head until your arms are fully extended. Lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner.

name: Shoulder Press - Reverse Grip
description: An exercise targeting the shoulders, performed with a reverse (underhand) grip to emphasize different shoulder muscles.
howTo: Stand or sit with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell or dumbbells with an underhand grip (palms facing upward). Lift the weight overhead until your arms are fully extended. Lower the weight back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner, maintaining the reverse grip throughout the movement.

name: Shoulder Press - Standing Barbell
description: A fundamental shoulder exercise performed standing with a barbell, targeting overall shoulder strength and stability.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grasping a barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lift the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended. Lower the barbell back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner.

name: Shrugs - Barbell Wide Grip
description: An exercise targeting the trapezius muscles, performed with a wide grip using a barbell.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with a wide overhand grip (hands positioned wider than shoulder-width). Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible, squeezing the traps at the top. Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner.

name: Shrugs - Hanging Low Trap
description: An exercise targeting the lower trapezius muscles, typically performed with a focus on controlled movement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells or a barbell with an overhand grip. Allow your arms to hang straight down. Lift your shoulders up and back, focusing on squeezing the lower traps. Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner.

name: Shrugs - Seated Supinated
description: An exercise targeting the trapezius muscles, performed seated with a supinated grip.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support, feet flat on the floor, holding dumbbells or a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing upward). Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible, squeezing the traps at the top. Lower the weights back down in a controlled manner.

name: Shrugs - Standing
description: An exercise targeting the trapezius muscles, performed standing with dumbbells or a barbell.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells or a barbell with an overhand grip. Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible, squeezing the traps at the top. Lower the weights back down in a controlled manner.

name: Upright Row - Wide Grip
description: An exercise targeting the shoulders and upper traps, performed with a wide grip.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell or dumbbells with an overhand grip wider than shoulder-width. Lift the weight straight up towards your chin, keeping it close to your body. Elbows should point out to the sides. Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner.

name: Pullover - Barbell Slight Incline
description: An exercise targeting the chest, back, and shoulders, performed on a slight incline with a barbell.
howTo: Lie on a bench set to a slight incline (around 30-45 degrees), feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with both hands extended over your chest, arms slightly bent. Lower the barbell behind your head towards the floor, feeling a stretch in your chest and lats. Pull the barbell back over your chest in a controlled manner.

name: Bent Over Barbell Rows
description: An exercise targeting the upper back, performed by bending over and pulling a barbell towards the abdomen.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, keeping elbows close to your body. Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner.

name: Bent Over Barbell Rows - 2 Count Hold
description: An advanced variation of bent over barbell rows where you hold the contraction at the top for a count of two.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, keeping elbows close to your body. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a count of two, then lower it back down in a controlled manner.

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rows
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed by bending over and pulling dumbbells towards the abdomen.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip. Pull the dumbbells towards your lower chest, keeping elbows close to your body. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner.

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rows - Wrap Around
description: An advanced variation of bent over dumbbell rows where the dumbbells are moved in a circular motion around the torso.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip. Pull one dumbbell towards your lower chest in a circular motion around your torso, following with the other dumbbell. Reverse the motion to return to the starting position. Alternate sides with each repetition.

name: Bent Over High Elbow Barbell Row
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, emphasizing a higher elbow position during the rowing movement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, keeping elbows high and close to your body. Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner.

name: Deadlifts
description: A compound exercise targeting the lower body and core muscles, performed by lifting a weight off the ground to a standing position.
howTo: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, with a barbell on the ground in front of you. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight and chest up. Grip the barbell with your hands just outside your knees. Engage your core and lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees to stand up straight. Lower the barbell back to the ground in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Deadlifts - Partial
description: A variation of deadlifts where the range of motion is reduced to focus on specific portions of the lift.
howTo: Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward, and a barbell placed in front of you. Bend at the hips and knees to grip the barbell with hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing your body. Keep your back straight and chest up as you lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees until you stand upright, but only lift the barbell partially (e.g., just below the knees). Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner, maintaining tension in the muscles.

name: Deadlifts - Pause
description: A variation of deadlifts where a pause is added at a specific point in the lift to increase time under tension and strength.
howTo: Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward, and a barbell placed in front of you. Bend at the hips and knees to grip the barbell with hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing your body. Keep your back straight and chest up as you lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees until you stand upright. Pause for a few seconds at the midpoint or at the top of the lift, then lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Row - Incline 45 Degrees
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed on an incline bench to emphasize different angles of the rowing motion.
howTo: Adjust an incline bench to a 45-degree angle. Lie face down on the bench with a dumbbell in one hand, arm fully extended towards the floor. Pull the dumbbell towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blade. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat.

name: Dumbbell Row - Incline 90 Degrees
description: An advanced variation of the dumbbell row performed on a steep incline bench to target the upper back and lats.
howTo: Adjust an incline bench to a 90-degree angle. Lie face down on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended towards the floor. Pull both dumbbells towards your hips simultaneously, keeping your elbows close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Row - Incline Tucked
description: A variation of the dumbbell row performed on an incline bench with a tucked elbow position, targeting the upper back and lats.
howTo: Adjust an incline bench to a comfortable angle. Lie face down on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended towards the floor. Pull both dumbbells towards your hips simultaneously, keeping your elbows close to your body and tucked in. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell High Elbow Row - 2 Part
description: An advanced variation of the dumbbell row targeting the upper back and lats, performed in two parts with high elbows for enhanced muscle activation.
howTo: Adjust an incline bench to a comfortable angle. Lie face down on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended towards the floor. Perform the first part by pulling the dumbbells towards your shoulders with high elbows, pausing at the top. For the second part, lower the dumbbells halfway down, then pull them back up to the top position. Finally, lower the dumbbells all the way back down in a controlled manner.

name: Bodyweight High Elbow Row
description: A bodyweight exercise targeting the upper back and shoulder muscles, performed by rowing your body upward with elbows high to enhance muscle engagement and stability.
howTo: Set up a bar or TRX handles at waist height. Hang underneath the bar with your body in a straight line, heels on the ground, and arms fully extended. Pull your chest towards the bar by bending your elbows out to the sides, keeping your elbows high and squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell High Elbow Row - Incline
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed on an incline bench with high elbows for enhanced muscle activation.
howTo: Adjust an incline bench to a comfortable angle. Lie face down on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended towards the floor. Pull the dumbbells towards your shoulders with your elbows high, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell High Elbow Row - Wall
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed with support from a wall to enhance muscle activation and control.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, facing a wall. Place your forehead against the wall for support. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with arms fully extended. Pull the dumbbells towards your shoulders with your elbows high, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner.

name: Standing Barbell Hypers
description: An exercise targeting the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings, performed standing with a barbell for enhanced muscle engagement.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your shoulders. Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent, lowering your torso until it is parallel to the floor. Engage your lower back, glutes, and hamstrings to lift your torso back to the starting position. Maintain control and proper form throughout the movement.

name: One Arm Row
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed with one arm to focus on unilateral strength and muscle engagement.
howTo: Place your right knee and right hand on a bench for support, holding a dumbbell in your left hand with your arm extended towards the floor. Pull the dumbbell towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blade. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat.

name: One Arm Row - Pronated
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed with one arm in a pronated grip to focus on unilateral strength and muscle engagement.
howTo: Place your right knee and right hand on a bench for support, holding a dumbbell in your left hand with a pronated (palm facing down) grip, arm extended towards the floor. Pull the dumbbell towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blade. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat.

name: Pullovers - Barbell
description: An exercise targeting the chest, back, and shoulders, performed lying on a bench with a barbell.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with both hands, arms extended over your chest. Lower the barbell back and down behind your head, feeling a stretch in your chest and lats. Pull the barbell back over your chest in a controlled manner.

name: Pullovers - Dumbbell
description: An exercise targeting the chest, back, and shoulders, performed lying on a bench with a dumbbell.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, arms extended over your chest. Lower the dumbbell back and down behind your head, feeling a stretch in your chest and lats. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest in a controlled manner.

name: Pull-Ups - Reverse Grip
description: An exercise targeting the upper back, biceps, and lats, performed with an underhand (supinated) grip.
howTo: Hang from a pull-up bar with an underhand grip (palms facing you), hands shoulder-width apart. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended. Repeat.

name: Pull-Ups - Reverse Grip Bench Assisted
description: An exercise targeting the upper back, biceps, and lats, performed with an underhand (supinated) grip using a bench for assistance.
howTo: Place a bench or sturdy platform under a pull-up bar. Stand on the bench and grip the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing you), hands shoulder-width apart. Use your legs to assist you as you pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended. Repeat.

name: Pull-Ups - Wide Grip
description: An exercise targeting the upper back, lats, and shoulders, performed with an overhand (pronated) wide grip.
howTo: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip (palms facing away from you), hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended. Repeat.

name: Shrugs - Barbell
description: An exercise targeting the trapezius muscles, performed with a barbell to enhance upper back and shoulder strength.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip in front of your thighs. Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible, squeezing the traps at the top. Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner.

name: Shrugs - Dumbbell
description: An exercise targeting the trapezius muscles, performed with dumbbells to enhance upper back and shoulder strength.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms at your sides. Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible, squeezing the traps at the top. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner.

name: T Bar Row
description: A compound exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed using a T-bar row machine or a landmine attachment.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Hold the handles of the T-bar row machine or a barbell attached to a landmine attachment. Pull the weight towards your lower chest, keeping elbows close to your body. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement. Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner.

name: T-Bar Row - One Arm
description: An exercise targeting the upper back and lats, performed with one arm using a T-bar row machine or a landmine attachment for unilateral strength development.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Hold the handle of the T-bar row machine or a barbell attached to a landmine attachment with one hand. Place your other hand on your knee or a bench for support. Pull the weight towards your lower chest, keeping your elbow close to your body. Squeeze your shoulder blade at the top of the movement. Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat.

name: T-Bar Row - One Arm Meadows
description: An advanced variation of the one-arm T-bar row, emphasizing a unique grip and elbow position to target the upper back and lats.
howTo: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, next to a landmine attachment with a barbell. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Grip the end of the barbell with one hand, with your palm facing down. Place your other hand on your knee for support. Pull the weight towards your hip, keeping your elbow flared out slightly. Squeeze your shoulder blade at the top of the movement. Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat.

name: Barbell Bench Press - Incline
description: An upper chest-focused compound exercise performed on an incline bench with a barbell to enhance pectoral engagement.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a comfortable angle (around 30-45 degrees). Lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower the barbell to your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

name: Barbell Bench Press - Slight Incline
description: A compound exercise targeting the upper chest, performed on a bench with a slight incline using a barbell.
howTo: Set an incline bench to a slight angle (around 15-30 degrees). Lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower the barbell to your upper chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

name: Barbell Press - Flat
description: A compound exercise targeting the chest, performed on a flat bench using a barbell.
howTo: Lie back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower the barbell to your mid-chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle. Press the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

name: Coffin Press
description: An exercise targeting the chest, performed by pressing dumbbells together to emphasize the pectoral muscles.
howTo: Lie back on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Hold the dumbbells together at chest level with palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells upward while keeping them in contact with each other throughout the movement. Lower the dumbbells back to chest level in a controlled manner.

name: Crunch - Elbows To Knees
description: An abdominal exercise targeting the rectus abdominis, performed by bringing the elbows to the knees.
howTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head with elbows out to the sides. Lift your shoulders off the ground and simultaneously bring your knees towards your elbows by contracting your abdominal muscles. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Crunch - Weighted
description: An abdominal exercise targeting the rectus abdominis, performed by adding weight for increased resistance.
howTo: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a weight plate or dumbbell against your chest. Lift your shoulders off the ground by contracting your abdominal muscles, bringing your chest towards your knees. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner.

name: Dips
description: A compound exercise targeting the chest, triceps, and shoulders, performed using parallel bars or a dip station.
howTo: Grip the parallel bars or dip station with your arms fully extended and body straight. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows. Keep your torso slightly leaned forward to emphasize the chest, or stay upright to focus on the triceps.

name: Dips - Negatives
description: A triceps and chest exercise focusing on the eccentric phase of the dip movement to build strength and control.
howTo: Grip the parallel bars or dip station with your arms fully extended and body straight. Slowly lower your body by bending your elbows, taking 3-5 seconds to reach the bottom position where your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Use your feet to assist you back to the starting position or step up to the starting position if needed. Repeat the lowering phase for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dips - Tilted Forward
description: A variation of dips that emphasizes the chest muscles by tilting the torso forward during the movement.
howTo: Grip the parallel bars or dip station with your arms fully extended and body straight. Lean your torso slightly forward as you lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows, keeping your torso leaned forward throughout the movement.

name: Dips - Weighted
description: A variation of dips using additional weight for increased resistance, targeting the triceps, chest, and shoulders.
howTo: Attach a weighted belt or hold a dumbbell between your legs. Grip the parallel bars or dip station with your arms fully extended and body straight. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground. Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press - Flat
description: An exercise targeting the chest muscles using dumbbells, performed on a flat bench.
howTo: Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, positioned at chest level with palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then lower them back down to chest level in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press - Flat Rotating
description: A chest exercise targeting the pectoral muscles, performed by pressing dumbbells from the chest while rotating the wrists from a neutral to a pronated position.
howTo: Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Press the dumbbells upward while rotating your wrists so that your palms face forward at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position while rotating your wrists back to a neutral grip. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press - Incline
description: An upper chest exercise using dumbbells on an inclined bench.
howTo: Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, positioned at chest level with palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then lower them back down to chest level in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press - Slight Incline
description: A variation of the dumbbell bench press performed on a bench with a slight incline, targeting the upper chest muscles.
howTo: Lie on a bench with a slight incline (around 15-30 degrees) with a dumbbell in each hand, positioned at chest level with palms facing forward. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended, then lower them back down to chest level in a controlled manner.

name: Dumbbell Fly - Full ROM & Partials
description: A chest exercise using dumbbells, combining full range of motion (ROM) and partial reps to target the pectoral muscles effectively.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended directly above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells to the sides in a wide arc until your chest muscles are fully stretched. Return to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles and bringing the dumbbells back together. Perform partial reps by lowering the dumbbells halfway down and returning to the starting position without fully extending your arms.

name: Dumbbell Fly - Incline
description: A chest exercise using dumbbells on an inclined bench to target the upper chest muscles.
howTo: Set an incline bench to around 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended directly above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells to the sides in a wide arc until your chest muscles are fully stretched. Return to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles and bringing the dumbbells back together.

name: Dumbbell Fly - Low
description: A chest exercise using dumbbells performed with the arms at a lower angle to target the lower portion of the pectoral muscles.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended directly above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells to the sides in a wide arc with elbows slightly bent, focusing on the lower portion of the chest. Return to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles and bringing the dumbbells back together.

name: Dumbbell Fly - Partials at Bottom
description: A chest exercise using dumbbells, focusing on partial repetitions at the bottom range of motion to target the pectoral muscles effectively.
howTo: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended directly above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells to the sides in a wide arc until your chest muscles are fully stretched. Perform partial repetitions by only lowering the dumbbells halfway down and returning to the starting position without fully extending your arms.

name: Dumbbell Scoop Fly - Seated
description: A chest exercise using dumbbells, performed seated to isolate and target the pectoral muscles.
howTo: Sit on a bench with back support and hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended directly above your chest, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells in a scooping motion, bringing them outward and downward in a wide arc until your chest muscles are fully stretched. Return to the starting position by squeezing your chest muscles and bringing the dumbbells back together.

name: Floor Press
description: A chest and triceps exercise performed lying on the floor, similar to a bench press but with a limited range of motion.
howTo: Lie on your back on the floor with knees bent and feet flat. Hold a barbell or dumbbells with arms extended directly above your chest. Lower the weight until your upper arms touch the floor, then press it back up to the starting position without locking out your elbows.

name: Hanging Knee Raises - Weighted
description: A core exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, performed by raising the knees towards the chest while hanging from a bar, with added weight for increased resistance.
howTo: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended and legs straight. Hold a dumbbell or medicine ball between your feet or use ankle weights. Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest, keeping the movement controlled. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
description: An advanced abdominal exercise performed hanging from a bar, targeting the lower abs and hip flexors.
howTo: Hang from a pull-up bar with arms fully extended and legs straight. Keep your legs together and lift them upward until they form a 90-degree angle with your torso. Lower your legs back down under control without swinging.

name: Knee Raises - Seated
description: A core exercise targeting the abdominal muscles, performed by raising the knees towards the chest while seated to enhance muscle engagement and core strength.
howTo: Sit on a bench or chair with your back straight and feet flat on the ground. Place your hands on the sides of the bench for support. Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest, keeping the movement controlled. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Poor Man's Ab Roller
description: An abdominal exercise using a barbell with plates, simulating the movement of an ab roller.
howTo: Kneel on a mat with a barbell loaded with weight plates in front of you. Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Roll the barbell forward along the ground as far as possible while keeping your arms extended. Use your core muscles to control the movement and roll the barbell back to the starting position.

name: Push-Ups
description: A classic bodyweight exercise targeting the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
howTo: Start in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push back up to the starting position, straightening your arms.

name: Push-Ups - Decline
description: A variation of push-ups performed with elevated feet, targeting the upper chest and shoulders more intensely.
